definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Jeff: I'm just afraid that you're going to burn in Hell for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我只是擔心，你將會因爲這一切而死無葬身之地。

sentences.english: If marriage is love's gravestone, then those who do not marry die in unnamed graves.
sentences.chinese: 如果婚姻是愛情的墳墓，沒有婚姻就是死無葬身之地。

sentences.english: Will new technologies kill the mail?
sentences.chinese: 新技術會不會讓郵件死無葬身之地？

definition: to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
